image.altText: Judy and Bob Dent in an older photo. He is wearing a navy suit and she is wearing a long white dress.

props.synopsis: On the verandah of their Darwin home, Judy Dent held her husband's hand as he became the first person in the world to die through legally accessible voluntary assisted dying. That world-first would not be possible in the Northern Territory today.

title.children: Judy's husband was the first person in the world to die under VAD laws

image.altText: A man in a boat holding up a fish he caught.

props.synopsis: The political party governing the Northern Territory announces a new president, just days after the opposition welcomed a former chief minister into its own leadership role.

title.children: Fishing fanatic and long-time CLP supporter to lead as party president

image.altText: Pro-Palestinian protesters gather in Sydney's Hyde Park with flags and signs

props.synopsis: The rallies in cities and towns dubbed the Nationwide Rally for Palestine come less than a week after the second anniversary of the October 7 terrorist attack.

title.children: Thousands join pro-Palestinian rallies in towns and cities amid ceasefire

image.altText: Two hands hold a phone. The person is wearing pink and black striped fingerless gloves. The phone has a charm hanging from it.

props.synopsis: LGBTIQA+ advocates are concerned the social media ban will have a significant impact on queer youth in regional and remote areas of Australia. They say there are not enough offline, physical supports for these teens to access when the ban comes into effect.

title.children: LGBTQIA+ advocates say social media ban will 'cut off' regional queer teens

image.altText: An outline of a woman.

props.synopsis: The NT has Australia's highest rates of domestic and family violence, with an intimate partner homicide rate seven times the national average.

title.children: The NT has changed its response to the DV crisis. Here's how

image.altText: A ceramic cross and dog statue

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have defended taking five days to appeal for information about a woman’s death in Darwin’s northern suburbs last month, since alleged to be a domestic violence-related murder.

title.children: Two alleged DV murders in two weeks as police defend time taken to investigate

image.altText: Two men and one woman, all Timorese, standing together, smiling in an industrial kitchen.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory struggles to find workers for low- and semi-skilled jobs, but with increasing numbers of foreign workers arriving under the Pacific Australia Labour Mobility (PALM) scheme, that may be changing.

title.children: From Dili to Darwin: Timor-Leste workers filling NT workforce shortages

image.altText: A young Aboriginal girl in sportswear, wearing a yellow bib, mid motion about to kick a soccer ball on a green field.

props.synopsis: Aussie rules football is life for many in remote NT Aboriginal communities but in Borroloola, barefoot young women and girls dream of following their hero into soccer's A-League.

title.children: The remote Aboriginal community where soccer reigns supreme

image.altText: Jim Chalmers super

props.synopsis: Every prominent criticism of the tax has been addressed, with the result that it will apply to fewer people and raise less money.

title.children: Labor has watered down its super tax proposal. Here's the new version

image.altText: Lidia Thorpe standing at a microphone at a public rally.

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police has issued a rare statement confirming it is investigating whether independent senator Lidia Thorpe broke any laws by saying she was prepared to "burn down Parliament House" in support of Palestinians.

title.children: AFP probes Lidia Thorpe's 'burn down Parliament House' remark

image.altText: a blonde white middle aged woman sitting with her hands clasped under her chin wearing glasses and a black top.

props.synopsis: The changes follow two high-profile departures from shadow cabinet within a month.

title.children: Ley unveils new shadow cabinet following Hastie resignation

image.altText: A black and white image of Donald Trump, overlaid with small yellow circles, his signature, and a helicopter.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's wealth has skyrocketed since his return to the White House nine months ago, leading to accusations that he is profiting from the presidency.

title.children: 'Outrageous conflict of interest': Crypto is making the Trumps hundreds of millions of dollars

image.altText: Kane Minion wearing a beanie with a dog sleeping on his chest

props.synopsis: Kane Minion was killed by dogs on a south-east Queensland property in 2022.

title.children: Coronial inquest begins into death of meter reader mauled by dogs

image.altText: A young girl sitting in a sandy alcove

props.synopsis: A medical episode has prevented Kieren Daniel Mittelheuser from appearing in court to face charges of accessory after the fact to murder.

title.children: Man accused in Pheobe Bishop case misses court for second time

image.altText: The silhouettes of four people. Behind them is a textured background with a red and white Qantas kangaroo logo.

props.synopsis: Hackers have released Qantas customer data onto the dark web. Here's what experts say to look out for if you think your personal data may be caught up in the leak and what actions you can take.

title.children: What can you do if your Qantas data has hit the dark web?

image.altText: Person in protective suit inside chamber with pipes and blue light.

props.synopsis: The two great technology revolutions of the modern era — artificial intelligence and renewable energy — are colliding.

title.children: Once the butt of jokes, now a great hope: The race for fusion energy

image.altText: Dolphin calf with tail tangled in fishing line.

props.synopsis: Marine rescuers issue an urgent plea for people to responsibly dispose of fishing gear after freeing a dolphin calf from a fishing line.

title.children: Dolphin calf rescued after spending weeks tangled in fishing line

image.altText: Essendon captain Zach Merrett stands in the race looking up as he waits to leads his team out at Carrara.

props.synopsis: Zach Merrett is one of a number of former All-Australians currently in limbo as West Coast continues to wheel and deal after another wooden spoon and Port Adelaide secures a midfielder.

title.children: Merrett deadlock continues as major AFL trades now racing the clock

image.altText: Carter Gordon playing for the Wallabies in 2023.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies waste no time in welcoming back fly half Carter Gordon to rugby union, less than two hours after it was announced he was leaving the NRL.

title.children: Gordon rushed back into Wallabies squad only hours after quitting NRL

image.altText: Woman in green blazer and shoulder-length brown hair looking off to the distance, a neutral expression on her face

props.synopsis: Jelena Dokic was abused by her father for years, with no tennis success enough to stop the beatings. She reveals the complex grief of losing a parent who showed no remorse.

title.children: Jelena Dokic tried to reconcile with her dad. His response shocked her

image.altText: a man with scruffy grey beard

props.synopsis: Independent MP Craig Garland applied in court for a restricted license, saying it would be a "terrible situation" if he wasn't able to attend parliamentary sitting weeks in Hobart due to the ban after being found guilty of drug driving.

title.children: MP handed six-month driving suspension over cannabis charge

image.altText: Mr Hasic in a black trench coat, pink shirt, smiling in front of a pier.

props.synopsis: Safuan Hasic, also known as Steven Hasic, has been barred from practising after breaching infection control standards at his Mortdale dentistry practice.

title.children: Sydney dentist denies claims patients potentially exposed to HIV

image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Premier has questioned the use of the word "toxic" to describe the state's ongoing algal bloom, despite the word being used in government advice and by scientists researching it.

title.children: SA Premier says algal bloom not 'toxic', despite word appearing in official advice

image.altText: Two women with short grey hair stand in front of a microphone outside the federal court building.

props.synopsis: Two separate appeals are launched in the Federal Court in a bid to overturn Environment Minister Murray Watt's approval of Woodside's gas hub extension on the North West Shelf.

title.children: Two groups launch Federal Court appeals against Woodside gas extension

image.altText: A large formation of bleached staghorn coral underwater in Ningaloo.

props.synopsis: An international report from climate scientists suggests tipping points for coral reefs have been reached, putting them at risk of dieback.

title.children: Planet's first climate tipping point already reached: international study

image.altText: Hannah Beazley sitting in Parliament.

props.synopsis: A debt-laden shire in WA's Goldfields has avoided being suspended over mismanagement allegations.

title.children: Embattled WA shire avoids being suspended over financial concerns

image.altText: Sue Webeck of the Domestic Violence Crisis Service

props.synopsis: A levy meant to improve support for victims of family violence in the ACT has come under scrutiny in an inquiry, which has heard concerns about how funds are managed.

title.children: Domestic violence levy review hears victims waiting days for help

image.altText: Close up of smiling young woman holding smartphone and tapping screen.

props.synopsis: You might assume home loan repayments will automatically reduce when an interest rate cut is passed on, but this isn’t always the case. Here's how to check.

title.children: How to reduce mortgage repayments after a rate cut

image.altText: A sign on a brick wall reads 'Western Sydney University', in the distance are some large buildings.

props.synopsis: As Western Sydney University prepares to shed hundreds of staff due to its dire finances, leaked documents reveal it is paying consultants as much as $2,850 a day.

title.children: University staff outraged as high-paid consultants work on redundancies

image.altText: A woman holding a bear.

props.synopsis: Pregnancy loss is a lottery determined by location, according to a report that has sparked calls for the federal government improve care for women who experience miscarriage in regional and rural communities.

title.children: Why some women are 'doubly isolated' by the loss of a baby

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing navy blue police uniform looks on sideways

props.synopsis: Victoria Police will slim down its executive team and divert more officers to the front line under reforms aimed at reducing crime in the state.

title.children: Victoria Police to slim down executive, divert more officers to front line

image.altText: Basil Zempilas and Michaelia Cash stand next to each other while a crowd applauds.

props.synopsis: The WA Liberals are told they need more women and a better candidate vetting process in a post-election review audit.

title.children: WA Liberals told they need more women, better candidates in post-election review

image.altText: a kaola called gage looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Koala deaths on Appin Road are not unusual this time of year, but the fatality of rescued koala Gage is cause for more than the usual frustration and despair.

title.children: Beloved koala killed after being hailed a conservation success story

image.altText: The GrainCorp factory in Numurkah emitting smoke.

props.synopsis: The class action was brought by a northern Victorian man who alleged that noise and odour pollution from a GrainCorp factory affected his health.

title.children: GrainCorp settles class action over noise and pollution

image.altText: Sunset over islands.

props.synopsis: The 14-year-old is in a critical but stable condition after emergency surgery at Townsville University Hospital.

title.children: Family of teen attacked by shark in Torres Strait grateful for support
